reviewText: This DVD takes you through a rich and fascinating period in the history of picture frames.

For anyone who enjoys a visual aid.  This video allows you to distinguish between framing appropriately and not.  The intricate detail provided by the narrator of each aspect of a frame and its various ornamentation, etc., is enlightening.

The authors of this video are clearly well-versed in the art of finishing and restoring period frames as well as their general history. It is a highly informative video on the fascinating and rich history of picture framing.
An excellent reference for art enthusiasts on the design and manufacture behind period antique frames in American art.
This video will help you to understand the variety of styles that picture frames were produced in in 19th and early 20th century America.
This video leads you through a fascinating period in American art, through the eyes of Ms. Smeaton.  A uniquely frame-centric perspective from a consumate scholar.
